intro: Conyza graveolens, commonly known as the horseweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Conyza graveolens is also known for its ability to produce a strong, unpleasant odor, which can be a distinguishing feature.
